sources.name: Polity IV + Wimmer and Min (Our World In Data)
sources.description:
Two sources – Center for Systemic Peace + Wimmer and Min (2006) –  combined for Our World In Data

Data provider Center for Systemic Peace
Source Polity IV data set
Description Polity 2 Measure that ranges from -10 (autocracy) to +10 (full democracy)
Linkhttp://www.columbia.edu/~aw2951/Datasets.html
Retrieved29 January 2016

Source 2: Wimmer and Min
Data provider Academic Paper
Source Wimmer and Min (2006) – “From empire to nation-state: Explaining war in the modern world, 1816-2001”, American Sociological Review 71(6):867-897, 2006.
Description Information about the colonial power
Linkhttp://www.columbia.edu/~aw2951/Datasets.html
Retrieved29 January 2016

Additional information

The original data provides information on each territory's colonial power. To be able to combine this with the numerical Polity2 metric I coded colonized countries as -20. If a country was coded as a colony in the Wimmer and Min data and had a value in the Polity 2 data set then I preferred the Polity 2 measure and this is shown in the final data set.

Max Roser

variables.name: Polity IV + Wimmer and Min (Our World In Data)
